Title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
Author: Delia Owens
Description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

Title: LITTLE FIRES EVERYWHERE
Author: Celeste Ng
Description: An artist upends a quiet town outside Cleveland.

Title: THE TATTOOIST OF AUSCHWITZ
Author: Heather Morris
Description: A concentration camp detainee tasked with permanently marking fellow prisoners falls in love with one of them.

Title: BEFORE WE WERE YOURS
Author: Lisa Wingate
Description: A South Carolina lawyer learns about the questionable practices of a Tennessee orphanage.

Title: THE SILENT PATIENT
Author: Alex Michaelides
Description: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.

Title: AMERICAN DIRT
Author: Jeanine Cummins
Description: A bookseller flees Mexico for the United States with her son while pursued by the head of a drug cartel.

Title: THE WOMAN IN THE WINDOW
Author: AJ Finn
Description: A recluse who drinks heavily and takes prescription drugs may have witnessed a crime across from her Harlem townhouse.

Title: THE DUTCH HOUSE
Author: Ann Patchett
Description: A sibling relationship is impacted when the family goes from poverty to wealth and back again over the course of many decades.

Title: THE GUARDIANS
Author: John Grisham
Description: Cullen Post, a lawyer and Episcopal minister, antagonizes some ruthless killers when he takes on a wrongful conviction case.

Title: THE GIVER OF STARS
Author: Jojo Moyes
Description: In Depression-era Kentucky, five women refuse to be cowed by men or convention as they deliver books.

Title: THE OUTSIDER
Author: Stephen King
Description: A detective investigates a seemingly wholesome member of the community when an 11-year-old boy’s body is found.

Title: THE INSTITUTE
Author: Stephen King
Description: Children with special talents are abducted and sequestered in an institution where the sinister staff seeks to extract their gifts through harsh methods.

Title: THE VANISHING HALF
Author: Brit Bennett
Description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

Title: THE GUEST LIST
Author: Lucy Foley
Description: A wedding between a TV star and a magazine publisher on an island off the coast of Ireland turns deadly.

Title: CAMINO WINDS
Author: John Grisham
Description: The line between fact and fiction becomes blurred when an author of thrillers is found dead after a hurricane hits Camino Island.

Title: THE TESTAMENTS
Author: Margaret Atwood
Description: In a sequel to “The Handmaid’s Tale,” old secrets bring three women together as the Republic of Gilead’s theocratic regime shows signs of decay.

Title: BLUE MOON
Author: Lee Child
Description: Jack Reacher gets caught up in a turf war between Ukrainian and Albanian gangs.

Title: 28 SUMMERS
Author: Elin Hilderbrand
Description: A relationship that started in 1993 between Mallory Blessing and Jake McCloud comes to light while she is on her deathbed and his wife runs for president.

Title: THEN SHE WAS GONE
Author: Lisa Jewell
Description: Ten years after her daughter disappears, a woman tries to get her life in order but remains haunted by unanswered questions.

Title: SUCH A FUN AGE
Author: Kiley Reid
Description: Tumult ensues when Alix Chamberlain’s babysitter is mistakenly accused of kidnapping her charge.

Title: NORMAL PEOPLE
Author: Sally Rooney
Description: The connection between a high school star athlete and a loner ebbs and flows when they go to Trinity College in Dublin.

Title: IF IT BLEEDS
Author: Stephen King
Description: Four novellas: “Mr. Harrigan’s Phone,” “The Life of Chuck,” “Rat” and “If It Bleeds.”

Title: WALK THE WIRE
Author: David Baldacci
Description: The sixth book in the Memory Man series. Decker and Jamison investigate a murder in a North Dakota town in a fracking boom.

Title: THE LAST WISH
Author: Andrzej Sapkowski
Description: Linked stories follow the exploits of Geralt of Rivia, a monster-slaying mercenary.

Title: THE WATER DANCER
Author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
Description: A young man who was gifted with a mysterious power becomes part of a war between slavers and the enslaved.

Title: A MINUTE TO MIDNIGHT
Author: David Baldacci

Title: OLIVE, AGAIN

Description: In a follow-up to the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel “Olive Kitteridge,” new relationships, including a second marriage, are encountered in a seaside town in Maine.

Title: CRISS CROSS
Author: James Patterson
Description: The 27th book in the Alex Cross series. Copycat crimes make the detective question whether an innocent man was executed.

Title: THE NICKEL BOYS
Author: Colson Whitehead
Description: Two boys respond to horrors at a Jim Crow-era reform school in ways that impact them decades later.

Title: THE NIGHT FIRE
Author: Michael Connelly
Description: Harry Bosch and Renée Ballard return to take up a case that held the attention of Bosch’s mentor.

Title: THE BOY FROM THE WOODS
Author: Harlan Coben

Title: THE ORDER
Author: Daniel Silva
Description: The 20th book in the Gabriel Allon series. The art restorer and spy cuts his family’s vacation short to investigate whether Pope Paul VII was murdered.

Title: THE SUMMER HOUSE
Author: James Patterson and Brendan DuBois

Title: THE OVERSTORY
Author: Richard Powers
Description: Winner of the 2019 Pulitzer Prize for fiction. Nine people drawn to trees for different reasons fight for the last of the remaining acres of virgin forest.

Title: IN FIVE YEARS
Author: Rebecca Serle

Title: TWISTED TWENTY-SIX
Author: Janet Evanovich
Description: The 26th book in the Stephanie Plum series. A New Jersey gangster’s associates go after a bounty hunter’s widowed grandmother.

Title: BIG SUMMER
Author: Jennifer Weiner

Title: ALL ADULTS HERE
Author: Emma Straub

Title: HIDEAWAY
Author: Nora Roberts
Description: A child star escapes her abductors, gathers herself in western Ireland and returns to Hollywood.

Title: GOLDEN IN DEATH
Author: JD Robb
Description: The 50th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas seeks the sender of packages that give off toxic airborne fumes.

Title: NEAR DARK
Author: Brad Thor
Description: The 19th book in the Scot Harvath series. With a bounty on his head, Harvath makes an alliance with a Norwegian intelligence operative.

Title: FAIR WARNING
Author: Michael Connelly
Description: The third book in the Jack McEvoy series. A reporter tracks a killer who uses genetic data to pick his victims.

Title: DEAR EDWARD
Author: Ann Napolitano
Description: A 12-year-old boy tries to start over after becoming the sole survivor of a plane crash in which he lost his immediate family.

Title: BLINDSIDE
Author: James Patterson and James O Born
Description: The 12th book in the Michael Bennett series. A serial-killing spree might impact national security.

Title: THE GLASS HOTEL
Author: Emily St John Mandel
Description: Years after an international Ponzi scheme falls apart, one of its victims investigates the disappearance of a woman from a container ship.

Title: THE 20TH VICTIM
Author: James Patterson and Maxine Paetro

Title: SEX AND VANITY
Author: Kevin Kwan

Title: DAISY JONES & THE SIX
Author: Taylor Jenkins Reid

Title: THE MIRROR & THE LIGHT
Author: Hilary Mantel
Description: The third book in the Wolf Hall trilogy. After Anne Boleyn’s execution, Thomas Cromwell’s enemies assemble.

Title: LOST
Author: James Patterson and James O Born
Description: The new head of an F.B.I. task force takes on a crime syndicate run by a pair of Russian nationals.

Title: LONG RANGE
Author: CJ Box
Description: The 20th book in the Joe Pickett series. A grizzly bear attack and an attempted assassination of a local judge baffle the Wyoming game warden.

Title: 1ST CASE
Author: James Patterson and Chris Tebbetts
Description: After getting kicked out of M.I.T., Angela Hoot interns with the F.B.I. and tracks the murderous siblings known as the Poet and the Engineer.

Title: SQUEEZE ME
Author: Carl Hiaasen

Title: LONG BRIGHT RIVER
Author: Liz Moore
Description: Mickey risks her job with the Philadelphia police force by going after a murderer and searching for her missing sister.

Title: THE BOOK OF LONGINGS
Author: Sue Monk Kidd
Description: A scholarly young woman named Ana meets an 18-year-old Jesus and becomes caught up in a confluence of dangers.

Title: MASKED PREY
Author: John Sandford
Description: The 30th book in the Prey series. Washington politicians ask Lucas Davenport to look into someone who is targeting their children.

Title: A LONG PETAL OF THE SEA
Author: Isabel Allende
Description: A young pregnant widow and an Army doctor take a ship to Chile to escape the aftermath of the Spanish Civil War.

Title: ROYAL
Author: Danielle Steel
Description: In 1943, the 17-year-old Princess Charlotte assumes a new identity in the country and falls in love.

Title: THICK AS THIEVES
Author: Sandra Brown
Description: Arden Maxwell returns home to uncover the truth about her father’s involvement in a heist that went wrong 20 years ago.

Title: THE WIVES
Author: Tarryn Fisher
Description: A woman discovers something disturbing about her polygamist husband.

Title: THE MIDWIFE MURDERS
Author: James Patterson and Richard DiLallo
Description: A single mom teams up with an N.Y.P.D. detective to solve a case involving misdeeds at a university hospital.

Title: THE HARBINGER II
Author: Jonathan Cahn
Description: Nouriel, Ana Goren and a figure known as "the prophet" return as revelations are unlocked.

Title: BLOOD OF ELVES
Author: Andrzej Sapkowski
Description: The first book in the Witcher series. As war looms, Geralt of Rivia must protect the prophesied savior of the world.

Title: REDHEAD BY THE SIDE OF THE ROAD
Author: Anne Tyler
Description: Micah Mortimer’s orderly existence is thrown off kilter when his partner faces eviction and a teenager claims to be his son.

Title: TOM CLANCY: FIRING POINT
Author: Mike Maden
Description: When an old friend is killed during the bombing of a Barcelona cafe, Jack Ryan Jr. searches for those responsible.

Title: CHASING CASSANDRA
Author: Lisa Kleypas
Description: The sixth book in the Ravenels series. Cassandra teaches a railway magnate a lesson.

Title: CROOKED RIVER
Author: Douglas Preston and Lincoln Child
Description: The 19th book in the Agent Pendergast series. Human feet inside nondescript shoes wash ashore in Florida.

Title: THE LYING LIFE OF ADULTS
Author: Elena Ferrante
Description: In this coming-of-age story, Giovanna seeks her true reflection in two kindred cities.

Title: MORAL COMPASS
Author: Danielle Steel

Title: THE LAST TRIAL
Author: Scott Turow
Description: An 85-year-old defense lawyer puts off his retirement to aid a Nobel Prize winner in Medicine, who is accused of insider trading, fraud and murder.

Title: MEXICAN GOTHIC
Author: Silvia Moreno-Garcia
Description: In 1950s Mexico, a debutante travels to a distant mansion where family secrets of a faded mining empire have been kept hidden.

Title: THE NUMBERS GAME
Author: Danielle Steel
Description: An affair wrecks a marriage and a daughter seeks to get out from her family’s shadow while old dreams and new love are pursued.

Title: THE SILENT WIFE
Author: Karin Slaughter
Description: The 10th book in the Will Trent series. Investigations of two crimes force Trent to call on his girlfriend's expertise as a medical examiner.

Title: JOURNEY OF THE PHARAOHS
Author: Clive Cussler and Graham Brown

Title: EVERYTHING I NEVER TOLD YOU
Author: Celeste Ng

Title: HOUSE OF EARTH AND BLOOD
Author: Sarah J Maas

Title: TRANSCENDENT KINGDOM
Author: Yaa Gyasi

Title: PEACE TALKS
Author: Jim Butcher

Title: TEXAS OUTLAW
Author: James Patterson and Andrew Bourelle

Title: THE BOOK OF LOST FRIENDS
Author: Lisa Wingate

Title: VALENTINE
Author: Elizabeth Wetmore

Title: ALL THE DEVILS ARE HERE
Author: Louise Penny

Title: DANCE AWAY WITH ME
Author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips

Title: VENDETTA ROAD
Author: Christine Feehan
Description: The third book in the Torpedo Ink series. After a breakup, Soleil meets a man in a Las Vegas biker bar.

Title: DARK SONG
Author: Christine Feehan

Title: WHEN YOU SEE ME
Author: Lisa Gardner
Description: D.D. Warren and Flora Dane join the F.B.I. agent Kimberly Quincy’s taskforce.

Title: DEACON KING KONG
Author: James McBride

Title: A GOOD NEIGHBORHOOD
Author: Therese Anne Fowler

Title: DEADLOCK
Author: Catherine Coulter
Description: The 24th book in the F.B.I. Thriller series. A young wife, a psychopath and three red boxes puzzle agents Savich and Sherlock.

Title: AXIOM'S END
Author: Lindsay Ellis

Title: THE WOODS
Author: Harlan Coben

Title: DESOLATION ROAD
Author: Christine Feehan
Description: The fourth book in the Torpedo Ink series. A biker wants to know what a local librarian is hiding.

Title: DEVOLUTION
Author: Max Brooks

Title: EMERALD BLAZE
Author: Ilona Andrews
Description: The latest installment in the Hidden Legacy series. Catalina Baylor overcomes heartbreak to team up with Alessandro Sagredo.

Title: A CONSPIRACY OF BONES
Author: Kathy Reichs

Title: A BEAUTIFULLY FOOLISH ENDEAVOR

Title: WRATH OF POSEIDON
Author: Clive Cussler and Robin Burcell
Description: The 12th book in the Sam and Remi Fargo Adventure series. A kingpin is released from prison and a final showdown takes place in Greece.

Title: FATE
Author: Helen Hardt
Description: The 13th book in the Steel Brothers Saga.

Title: FIRST COMES SCANDAL
Author: Julia Quinn

Title: DARING AND THE DUKE
Author: Sarah MacLean
Description: The third book in the Bareknuckle Bastards series.

Title: A WEEK AT THE SHORE
Author: Barbara Delinsky

Title: A PRIVATE CATHEDRAL
Author: James Lee Burke
Description: The 23rd book in the Dave Robicheaux series. Rival Louisiana crime families and a time-traveling superhuman assassin bring up Robicheaux’s personal demons.

Title: A WALK ALONG THE BEACH
Author: Debbie Macomber
Description: After dealing with loss and setbacks, two sisters take risks on dreams and love.

Title: TRUTH AND JUSTICE
Author: Fern Michaels
Description: The 31st book in the Sisterhood series. A con artist is behind a scheme involving fertility clinics.

Title: TREASON
Author: Stuart Woods
Description: The 52nd book in the Stone Barrington series. Stone is asked to expose a double agent in the State Department.

Title: ANXIOUS PEOPLE
Author: Fredrik Backman

Title: UTOPIA AVENUE
Author: David Mitchell

Title: TRACE ELEMENTS
Author: Donna Leon

Title: BOMBSHELL
Author: Stuart Woods and Parnell Hall

Title: CAJUN JUSTICE
Author: James Patterson and Tucker Axum
Description: Cain Lemaire, an ex-Secret Service agent from New Orleans, gets in the thick of things as the head of security for a chief executive in Tokyo.

Title: AMERICAN DEMON
Author: Kim Harrison
Description: The 14th book in the Hollows series.

Title: THE WEDDING DRESS
Author: Danielle Steel

Title: CHOPPY WATER
Author: Stuart Woods
Description: The 54th book in the Stone Barrington series. Things get rough for Stone as he goes after criminals in New York City and Key West.

Title: COCONUT LAYER CAKE MURDER
Author: Joanne Fluke

Title: THRAWN ASCENDANCY: CHAOS RISING
Author: Timothy Zahn
Description: In this Star Wars saga, a young military officer is sent to find the unseen enemies who attacked the Chiss capital.

Title: DADDY'S GIRLS
Author: Danielle Steel

Title: AGENCY
Author: William Gibson
Description: Ainsley Lowbeer can see alternate outcomes for Verity Jane and her digital assistant, who lived in the previous century.

Title: BEACH READ
Author: Emily Henry

Title: FRIENDS AND STRANGERS
Author: J Courtney Sullivan
Description: Complications ensue when a New York journalist downshifts to become a mom in a small town and hires a senior at the local women’s college to babysit.

Title: HUNTER KILLER
Author: Brad Taylor
Description: The 14th book in the Pike Logan series. Pike has a hunch Taskforce is being targeted.

Title: HARROW THE NINTH
Author: Tamsyn Muir
Description: The second book of the Locked Tomb trilogy. Harrowhark Nonagesimus must overcome her failing health to become an angel of undeath.

Title: HELLO, SUMMER
Author: Mary Kay Andrews
Description: Conley Hawkins loses her big-city beat and takes over the gossip column of her family’s small-town newspaper.

Title: SAVAGE SON
Author: Jack Carr
Description: The third book in the Terminal List series. The Russian mafia targets a former Navy SEAL who is recovering from brain surgery.

Title: THE LIES THAT BIND
Author: Emily Giffin
Description: When the new man in her life disappears on 9/11, the budding reporter Cecily Gardner questions what she knew about him.

Title: SHADOW FLIGHT
Author: Christine Feehan
Description: The fifth book in the Shadow Riders series. Taviano Ferraro steps outside his crime family’s rules to keep Nicoletta Gomez safe.

Title: SHADOWS IN DEATH
Author: JD Robb
Description: The 51st book of the In Death series. A hitman with possible connections to Eve Dallas’s husband is seen near the scene of a crime.

Title: SMOKE BITTEN
Author: Patricia Briggs
Description: The 12th book in the Mercy Thompson series. The car mechanic who has the ability to turn into a coyote takes on a deadly foe.

Title: SOMEONE TO ROMANCE
Author: Mary Balogh
Description: The seventh book in the Westcott series. Gabriel Thorne’s intention to wed Lady Jessica Archer misses its mark at first.

Title: STAR WARS: THE RISE OF SKYWALKER
Author: Rae Carson
Description: The Resistance goes on a new adventure as word of the re-emergence of Emperor Palpatine is sent across the galaxy.

Title: THE LAST ODYSSEY
Author: James Rollins
Description: The 15th book in the Sigma Force series. Catastrophic dangers might be set in motion when a medieval ship is discovered in Greenland.

Title: SUCKER PUNCH
Author: Laurell K Hamilton
Description: The 27th book in the Anita Blake, Vampire Hunter series. The evidence that a wereleopard killed his uncle doesn’t add up.

Title: THE LAST FLIGHT
Author: Julie Clark

Title: THE LAST EMPEROX
Author: John Scalzi
Description: The third book in the Interdependency series. As an interstellar pathway collapses, Emperox Grayland II fights to save humanity.

Title: THE BOOK OF LOST NAMES
Author: Kristin Harmel

Title: THE JETSETTERS
Author: Amanda Eyre Ward
Description: Old pains are unpacked as the fractured Perkins family goes on a trip through Europe.

Title: THE CITY WE BECAME
Author: NK Jemisin
Description: People from different walks of life in New York City receive messages through various senses.

Title: THE COUNTRY GUESTHOUSE
Author: Ron Carr
Description: The fifth book in the Sullivan's Crossing series.

Title: THE DARKEST EVENING
Author: Ann Cleeves
Description: The ninth book in the Vera Stanhope series. An abandoned toddler, a dead woman and a blizzard complicate the holidays in the Northumberland countryside.

Title: THE JACKAL
Author: JR Ward
Description: In the Black Dagger Brotherhood world, Nyx searches for her sister in a lost prison camp and meets a man known as the Jackal.

Title: THE END OF HER
Author: Shari Lapena
Description: The parents of colicky twin girls have other trouble delivered in the form of suspicions surrounding the husband’s first wife’s death.

Title: THE END OF OCTOBER
Author: Lawrence Wright
Description: Henry Parsons, a microbiologist and epidemiologist, goes to Indonesia to check out a deadly virus that soon will affect the entire planet.

Title: THE EXILES
Author: Christina Baker Kline
Description: Three young women are sent to the fledgling British penal colony of Australia in the 1840s.

Title: THE FRIENDSHIP LIST
Author: Susan Mallery
Description: A single mom and a widow take on challenges to push themselves outside their comfort zones.

Title: WRITERS & LOVERS
Author: Lily King
Description: Casey Peabody goes through a big life transition as she tries to maintain a creative life.

Title: RODHAM
Author: Curtis Sittenfeld
Description: An imaginative look at the life and career one woman might have had if she had not married Bill Clinton.

Title: REVENGE
Author: James Patterson and Andrew Holmes
Description: A former member of the British Special Air Service looks into the death of a young woman in London at her parent’s urging.

Title: LETHAL GAME
Author: Christine Feehan
Description: The 16th book in the GhostWalker series. When Amaryllis is endangered, Malichai’s true identity risks being exposed.

Title: THE WARSAW PROTOCOL
Author: Steve Berry
Description: The 15th book in the Cotton Malone series. The balance of power in Europe is imperiled.

Title: HIT LIST
Author: Stuart Woods
Description: The 53rd book in the Stone Barrington series. The former N.Y.P.D. detective takes it upon himself to get the target off his back.

Title: HOME BEFORE DARK
Author: Riley Sager
Description: When Maggie Holt inherits the Vermont estate that was the setting of her father’s horror memoir she is confronted by some of the people and relics he chronicled.

Title: THE HENNA ARTIST
Author: Alka Joshi
Description: In 1950s Jaipur, a young woman who escaped an abusive marriage and started a new life is confronted by her husband.

Title: HUNTING FOR A HIGHLANDER
Author: Lynsay Sands
Description: The eighth book in the Highland Brides series. Geordie Buchanan and Lady Dwyn Innes have a chance encounter in an orchard.

Title: HUSH
Author: James Patterson and Candice Fox
Description: The fourth book in the Detective Harriet Blue series. The man who put her in prison asks Harriet Blue to find missing members of his family.

Title: THE VANISHING
Author: Jayne Ann Krentz
Description: A killer goes after a pair of Seattle investigators who witnessed a murder 15 years ago in the secretive town of Fogg Lake.

Title: THE SINNER
Author: JR Ward
Description: The 18th book in the Black Dagger Brotherhood series. Jo Early is attracted to a potentially dangerous stranger.

Title: INSATIABLE
Author: Helen Hardt
Description: The 12th book in the Steel Brothers Saga.

Title: THE OTHER MRS.
Author: Mary Kubica
Description: A Chicago couple becomes unsettled when they move to an old house in Maine and their new neighbor turns up dead.

Title: PARTY OF TWO
Author: Jasmine Guillory
Description: Olivia Monroe’s past is uncovered when her relationship with a junior senator is made public.

Title: THE NIGHT WATCHMAN
Author: Louise Erdrich
Description: As a bill that may hurt the rights of Native Americans goes to Congress in 1953, domestic issues arise for plant workers near the Turtle Mountain Reservation in North Dakota.

Title: THE MUSEUM OF DESIRE
Author: Jonathan Kellerman
Description: The 35th book in the Alex Delaware series. Four unrelated victims are found slaughtered in a limousine.

Title: MY DARK VANESSA
Author: Kate Elizabeth Russell
Description: A woman re-evaluates the relationship she had at age 15 with her 42-year-old English teacher 17 years ago.

Title: NETWORK EFFECT
Author: Martha Wells
Description: The fifth book in the Murderbot Diaries series.

Title: THE LOST AND FOUND BOOKSHOP
Author: Susan Wiggs
Description: Natalie Harper takes over the care of her mother’s bookshop and her ailing grandfather.

Title: ON OCEAN BOULEVARD
Author: Mary Alice Monroe
Description: As her second wedding approaches, a woman returns to Charleston, S.C., where her family is dealing with changes.

Title: ONE BY ONE
Author: Ruth Ware
Description: An avalanche tests the bonds of coworkers from a London-based tech startup on a corporate retreat in the French Alps.

Title: ONE MINUTE OUT
Author: Mark Greaney
Description: The ninth book in the Gray Man series. Court Gentry tries to stop the head of a group trafficking women and children.

Title: OUTSIDER
Author: Linda Castillo
Description: The 12th book in the Kate Burkholder series. A cop goes into hiding on an Amish widower’s farm while a killer lies in wait.

Title: YOU ARE NOT ALONE
Author: Greer Hendricks and Sarah Pekkanen
Description: Shay Miller’s bad luck may get even worse when she meets a pair of sisters who always get what they want.

Title: EDUCATED
Author: Tara Westover
Description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.

Title: SAPIENS
Author: Yuval Noah Harari
Description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.

Title: BECOMING
Author: Michelle Obama
Description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.

Title: BORN A CRIME
Author: Trevor Noah

Title: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME
Author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
Description: Winner of the 2015 National Book Award for nonfiction. A meditation on race in America as well as a personal story, framed as a letter to the author's teenage son.

Title: ALEXANDER HAMILTON
Author: Ron Chernow
Description: A biography of the first Treasury secretary. The basis of the Tony Award-winning Broadway musical.

Title: JUST MERCY
Author: Bryan Stevenson
Description: A law professor and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.

Title: BAD BLOOD
Author: John Carreyrou
Description: The rise and fall of Theranos, the biotech startup that failed to deliver on its promise to make blood testing more efficient.

Title: TALKING TO STRANGERS
Author: Malcolm Gladwell
Description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.

Title: MAYBE YOU SHOULD TALK TO SOMEONE
Author: Lori Gottlieb
Description: A psychotherapist gains unexpected insights when she becomes another therapist’s patient.

Title: UNTAMED
Author: Glennon Doyle
Description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.

Title: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE
Author: Erik Larson
Description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.

Title: WHITE FRAGILITY
Author: Robin DiAngelo
Description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.

Title: ON TYRANNY
Author: Timothy Snyder
Description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.

Title: THE PIONEERS
Author: David McCullough
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning historian tells the story of the settling of the Northwest Territory through five main characters.

Title: THE MAMBA MENTALITY
Author: Kobe Bryant
Description: Various skills and techniques used on the court by the late Los Angeles Lakers player.

Title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST
Author: Ibram X Kendi
Description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.

Title: GRIT
Author: Angela Duckworth
Description: A psychologist argues that passion and perseverance are the keys to success.

Title: GRANT
Author: Ron Chernow
Description: A biography of the Union general of the Civil War and two-term president of the United States.

Title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
Author: Bessel van der Kolk
Description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

Title: I'LL BE GONE IN THE DARK
Author: Michelle McNamara
Description: The late true-crime journalist's search for the serial murderer and rapist known as "the Golden State Killer."

Title: THE LIBRARY BOOK
Author: Susan Orlean
Description: The story of the 1986 fire at the Los Angeles Public Library provides a backdrop to the evolution and purpose of libraries.

Title: THE BODY
Author: Bill Bryson
Description: An owner’s manual of the human body covering various parts, functions and what happens when things go wrong.

Title: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE
Author: Ijeoma Oluo
Description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States.

Title: SAY NOTHING
Author: Patrick Radden Keefe
Description: A look at the conflict in Northern Ireland known as the Troubles.

Title: ME
Author: Elton John
Description: The multi-award-winning solo artist's first autobiography chronicles his career, relationships and private struggles.

Title: BLOWOUT
Author: Rachel Maddow
Description: The MSNBC host argues that the global oil and gas industry has weakened democracies and bolstered authoritarians.

Title: THE GREAT INFLUENZA
Author: John M Barry
Description: An overview of the 1918 flu epidemic and cautionary tale for similar kinds of large-scale outbreaks.

Title: CATCH AND KILL
Author: Ronan Farrow
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter details some surveillance and intimidation tactics used to pressure journalists and elude consequences by certain wealthy and connected men.

Title: A WOMAN OF NO IMPORTANCE
Author: Sonia Purnell
Description: The true story of a Baltimore socialite who joined a spy organization during World War II and became essential to the French Resistance.

Title: THE BOOK OF GUTSY WOMEN
Author: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Chelsea Clinton
Description: Profiles of women from around the world who have blazed trails and challenged the status quo.

Title: OPEN BOOK
Author: Jessica Simpson with Kevin Carr O’Leary
Description: The singer, actress and fashion designer discloses times of success, trauma and addiction.

Title: ME AND WHITE SUPREMACY
Author: Layla F Saad
Description: Ways to understand and possibly counteract white privilege.

Title: TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH
Author: Mary L Trump
Description: The clinical psychologist gives her assessment of events and patterns inside her family and how they shaped President Trump.

Title: UNORTHODOX
Author: Deborah Feldman
Description: A woman breaks free of the Satmar Hasidic community in Brooklyn in which she was raised.

Title: THE NEW JIM CROW
Author: Michelle Alexander
Description: A law professor takes aim at the “war on drugs,” mass incarceration and their impact on Black men.

Title: SAM HOUSTON AND THE ALAMO AVENGERS
Author: Brian Kilmeade
Description: The "Fox & Friends” host gives an account of the battle against the Mexican Army in 1836.

Title: STAMPED FROM THE BEGINNING
Author: Ibram X Kendi
Description: Winner of the 2016 National Book Award for nonfiction. A look at anti-Black racist ideas and their effect on the course of American history.

Title: TRIGGERED
Author: Donald Trump Jr
Description: Forays into politics and views on liberals from the executive vice president of the Trump Organization.

Title: FINDING CHIKA
Author: Mitch Albom
Description: Lessons learned by the Alboms when they bring a Haitian orphan with a life-threatening illness into their family.

Title: A VERY STABLE GENIUS
Author: Philip Rucker and Carol Leonnig
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalists use firsthand accounts to chart patterns of behavior within the Trump administration.

Title: I HEARD YOU PAINT HOUSES
Author: Charles Brandt
Description: A World War II veteran works for a crime boss and comes into contact with the union boss Jimmy Hoffa. The basis of the movie "The Irishman."

Title: THE COLOR OF LAW
Author: Richard Rothstein
Description: An examination of the ways in which the government caused residential segregation through racial zoning and other systemic practices.

Title: HIDDEN VALLEY ROAD
Author: Robert Kolker
Description: From 1945 to 1965, a family in Colorado had 12 children, six of whom went on to develop schizophrenia.

Title: FORTITUDE
Author: Dan Crenshaw
Description: The Texas congressman and former Navy SEAL prescribes ways to overcome adversity.

Title: PROFILES IN CORRUPTION
Author: Peter Schweizer
Description: The author of “Clinton Cash” gives his evaluations of members of the Democratic Party.

Title: RANGE
Author: David Epstein
Description: An argument for how generalists excel more than specialists, especially in complex and unpredictable fields.

Title: A WARNING
Author: Anonymous
Description: A senior official in the Trump administration offers an assessment of the president and makes a moral appeal.

Title: CASTE
Author: Isabel Wilkerson
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.

Title: THE ROOM WHERE IT HAPPENED
Author: John Bolton
Description: The former national security advisor gives his account of the 17 months he spent working for President Trump.

Title: LIVE FREE OR DIE
Author: Sean Hannity
Description: The Fox News host offers his assessment on what is at stake in the 2020 election.

Title: THE WARMTH OF OTHER SUNS
Author: Isabel Wilkerson
Description: An account of the Great Migration of 1915-70, in which nearly six million African-Americans abandoned the South.

Title: THE TRUTHS WE HOLD
Author: Kamala Harris
Description: A memoir by the daughter of immigrants who is now a California senator and the 2020 Democratic candidate for vice president.

Title: BEGIN AGAIN
Author: Eddie S Glaude Jr
Description: An appraisal of the life and work of James Baldwin and their meaning in relation to the Black Lives Matter movement and the Trump presidency.

Title: FRONT ROW AT THE TRUMP SHOW
Author: Jonathan Karl
Description: The ABC News chief White House correspondent gives his perspective on our current president and describes the shifts within their relationship.

Title: THE HOUSE OF KENNEDY
Author: James Patterson and Cynthia Fagen
Description: A look at the achievements of the political family and what has been called “the Kennedy curse.”

Title: WHY WE SLEEP
Author: Matthew Walker
Description: A neuroscientist uses recent scientific discoveries to explain the functions of sleep and dreams.

Title: PLAGUE OF CORRUPTION
Author: Judy Mikovits and Kent Heckenlively
Description: The controversial virologist gives her account of her work over nearly four decades.

Title: HOW TO
Author: Randall Munroe
Description: The former NASA roboticist dispenses complex and excessive solutions to common problems.

Title: HOAX
Author: Brian Stelter
Description: The CNN anchor and chief media correspondent examines the inner workings of Fox News and its relationship with President Trump.

Title: HOW TO DESTROY AMERICA IN THREE EASY STEPS
Author: Ben Shapiro
Description: The conservative commentator describes what he perceives as threats to American history, ideals and culture.

Title: JOHN ADAMS UNDER FIRE
Author: Dan Abrams and David Fisher
Description: How the man who became the second president served as the defense lawyer for the British soldiers who stood accused in the Boston Massacre in 1770.

Title: IT WAS ALL A LIE
Author: Stuart Stevens
Description: The former political campaign strategist evaluates the changes within the Republican Party in the last half-century.

Title: MIDNIGHT IN CHERNOBYL
Author: Adam Higginbotham
Description: An account of the 1986 disaster at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, based on hundreds of hours of interviews.

Title: MORE MYSELF
Author: Alicia Keys with Michelle Burford
Description: The Grammy Award-winning musician retraces her path to discovering her own worth.

Title: THE ANSWER IS ...
Author: Alex Trebek
Description: Who is the Canadian-American game show host whose pronunciation of the word “genre” has been shared widely on social media?

Title: THE GIFT OF FORGIVENESS
Author: Katherine Schwarzenegger Pratt
Description: Stories, interviews and reflections on the act of letting go of resentment.

Title: WHY WE'RE POLARIZED
Author: Ezra Klein
Description: The editor at large and co-founder of Vox offers his take on what causes divisions in America.

Title: WHY ARE ALL THE BLACK KIDS SITTING TOGETHER IN THE CAFETERIA?
Author: Beverly Daniel Tatum
Description: The president emerita of Spelman College examines whether self-segregation is a problem or a coping strategy.

Title: COUNTDOWN 1945
Author: Chris Wallace with Mitch Weiss
Description: The Fox News Sunday anchor gives an account of the key people involved in and events leading up to America’s attack on Hiroshima in 1945.

Title: THE LINCOLN CONSPIRACY
Author: Brad Meltzer and Josh Mensch
Description: How Allan Pinkerton, along with undercover agents, thwarted a lesser-known assassination attempt of Abraham Lincoln in Baltimore in 1861.

Title: HIS TRUTH IS MARCHING ON
Author: Jon Meacham
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer creates a portrait of Representative John Lewis, the late civil rights leader and congressman for Georgia’s Fifth Congressional District.

Title: UNTIL THE END OF TIME
Author: Brian Greene
Description: A physicist gives an overview of how we got here, where we are and directions we might go.

Title: FINDING FREEDOM
Author: Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand
Description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s journey from courtship to their decision to step away from their royal lives.

Title: UNKNOWN VALOR
Author: Martha MacCallum
Description: The Fox News anchor weaves stories of combat veterans who fought during World War II.

Title: TO SHAKE THE SLEEPING SELF
Author: Jedidiah Jenkins
Description: The son of conservative Christians cycles from Oregon to Patagonia, reconciling his sexuality with his upbringing.

Title: TIGHTROPE
Author: Nicholas D Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning authors examine issues affecting working-class Americans.

Title: I'M STILL HERE
Author: Austin Channing Brown
Description: A black woman who was given a white man's name by her parents shares her journey to finding her own worth and what stands in the way of racial justice.

Title: RUNNING AGAINST THE DEVIL
Author: Rick Wilson
Description: The Republican strategist offers his insights on how to potentially defeat President Trump in the upcoming election.

Title: THE HOPE OF GLORY
Author: Jon Meacham
Description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer delves into the seven last sayings of Jesus as recorded in the Gospels.

Title: NO ONE IS TOO SMALL TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE
Author: Greta Thunberg
Description: Speeches by the Swedish climate activist, including her address to the United Nations.

Title: MOBITUARIES
Author: Mo Rocca and Jonathan Greenberg
Description: The humorist spotlights frequently unnoticed aspects of deceased celebrities and historical figures.

Title: DARK TOWERS
Author: David Enrich
Description: The New York Times finance editor traces the history and illicit dealings of Deutsche Bank.

Title: DONALD TRUMP V. THE UNITED STATES
Author: Michael S Schmidt
Description: The New York Times Washington correspondent details actions by officials who attempted to contain the president.

Title: BREATH
Author: James Nestor
Description: A re-examination of a basic biological function and a look at the science behind ancient breathing practices.

Title: MELANIA AND ME
Author: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff
Description: The former director of special events at Vogue describes parting ways with the First Lady after being made the scapegoat for inauguration finance irregularities.

Title: BOYS & SEX
Author: Peggy Orenstein
Description: How young men comprehend cultural forces and navigate sexual and emotional relationships.

Title: DISLOYAL
Author: Michael Cohen
Description: An account of President Trump’s business empire, political campaign and presidential administration by his former personal attorney.

Title: ABOUT YOUR FATHER AND OTHER CELEBRITIES I HAVE KNOWN
Author: Peggy Rowe
Description: Stories of living with a minimalist husband, cheering her son’s celebrity and having a late career as a commercial spokesperson.

Title: COMPROMISED
Author: Peter Strzok
Description: The former F.B.I. deputy assistant director of counterintelligence chronicles the investigation into Russia’s election interference and key moments from his career.

Title: CAPITAL AND IDEOLOGY
Author: Thomas Piketty
Description: An overview of political and economic inequality and a call for a more balanced approach to those systems.

Title: AMERICAN CRUSADE
Author: Pete Hegseth
Description: The "Fox & Friends Weekend" host gives his take on politics, culture and education.

Title: EAT A PEACH
Author: David Chang and Gabe Ulla
Description: A memoir by the chef and founder of Momofuku and the star of the Netflix series “Ugly Delicious.”

Title: AMERICAN OLIGARCHS
Author: Andrea Bernstein
Description: An investigative journalist traces the proliferation of the Trump and Kushner dynasties

Title: ARGUING WITH SOCIALISTS
Author: Glenn Beck
Description: The conservative commentator espouses free-market capitalism.

Title: DON'T BURN THIS BOOK
Author: Dave Rubin
Description: The internet show host explains why he moved away from progressive politics.

Title: EVIL GENIUSES
Author: Kurt Andersen
Description: The author of “Fantasyland” looks at the economic, cultural and political forces to which he ascribes the undermining and dismantling of the American middle class.

Title: EVERYTHING BEAUTIFUL IN ITS TIME
Author: Jenna Bush Hager
Description: Essays by the former first daughter and granddaughter celebrating the lives of her grandparents.

Title: DEADLIEST ENEMY
Author: Michael T Osterholm and Mark Olshaker
Description: How epidemics and pandemics can disrupt everyday life and world order.

Title: YOU NEVER FORGET YOUR FIRST
Author: Alexis Coe
Description: A newly researched biography of George Washington.

Title: HOLLYWOOD PARK
Author: Mikel Jollett
Description: The musician and author retraces his time growing up in an experimental commune and the difficulties he encountered after escaping it.

Title: THE FIRST TIME
Author: Colton Underwood
Description: A memoir by a former N.F.L. player and reality TV star of “The Bachelor” and “The Bachelorette.”

Title: WHY WE CAN'T SLEEP
Author: Ada Calhoun
Description: The cultural and political contexts of the crises that Generation X women face.

Title: WHEN TIME STOPPED
Author: Ariana Neumann
Description: The daughter of a man who created a false identity to escape Nazi-occupied Prague uncovers his difficult past.

Title: WALKING WITH THE WIND
Author: John Lewis and Michael D'Orso
Description: A memoir by the recently deceased leader in the American civil rights movement and representative for Georgia’s Fifth Congressional District.

Title: VESPER FLIGHTS
Author: Helen Macdonald
Description: A collection of observational essays by the nature writer on themes of captivity, immigration and freedom.

Title: UNCANNY VALLEY
Author: Anna Wiener
Description: A millennial’s memoir is interwoven with a look at changes within Silicon Valley.

Title: UN-TRUMPING AMERICA
Author: Dan Pfeiffer
Description: A former senior advisor to President Obama offers suggestions for Democrats.

Title: TWILIGHT OF THE GODS
Author: Ian W Toll
Description: The third book in the Pacific War trilogy describes the last year of World War II in the Pacific.

Title: TWILIGHT OF DEMOCRACY
Author: Anne Applebaum
Description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning historian looks at the rise of nationalism and authoritarianism around the world.

Title: TRUE CRIMES AND MISDEMEANORS
Author: Jeffrey Toobin
Description: The CNN chief legal analyst weaves a narrative of the Mueller investigation, President Trump’s impeachment and transgressions by key Trump figures.

Title: THE WORLD
Author: Richard Haass
Description: The president of the Council on Foreign Relations examines challenges to the United States from outside its borders.

Title: THE RURAL DIARIES
Author: Hilarie Burton Morgan
Description: The actress starts a family, transplants to a working farm and revitalizes a candy store in Rhinebeck, N.Y.

Title: THE OFFICE
Author: Andy Greene
Description: An oral history of the sitcom from its beginnings on the BBC through its nine-season run on American network TV.

Title: THE MAGA DOCTRINE
Author: Charlie Kirk
Description: The founder of Turning Point U.S.A. espouses some ideas promulgated by President Trump.

Title: THE LAST BOOK ON THE LEFT
Author: Ben Kissel, Marcus Parks and Henry Zebrowski
Description: A survey of serial killers from the creators of the Last Podcast on the Left.

Title: THE DYNASTY
Author: Jeff Benedict
Description: The history of the New England Patriots from N.F.L. laughingstock to making 10 trips to the Super Bowl.

Title: I HAVE SOMETHING TO TELL YOU
Author: Chasten Buttigieg
Description: The educator and advocate describes growing up gay in a small Midwestern town and meeting his husband, Pete.

Title: THE CHIFFON TRENCHES
Author: André Leon Talley
Description: A memoir by the former creative director at Vogue and a look at the changes in the fashion industry.

Title: THE BIG GOODBYE
Author: Sam Wasson
Description: The making of the film "Chinatown" and shifts in Hollywood during the 1970s.

Title: THE AGE OF ENTITLEMENT
Author: Christopher Caldwell
Description: An assessment of some potential social, cultural and economic causes of our current political fissure.

Title: SUCCESSFUL AGING
Author: Daniel J Levitin
Description: A neuroscientist suggests using resilience strategies as we grow older.

Title: SPEAKING FOR MYSELF
Author: Sarah Huckabee Sanders
Description: The former White House press secretary shares her perspective on her time working with President Trump

Title: SEPARATED
Author: Jacob Soboroff
Description: The NBC News correspondent examines the Trump administration’s systematic separation of migrant families at the U.S.-Mexico border and the living conditions of the children in custody.

Title: WOW, NO THANK YOU
Author: Samantha Ir
Description: Comedic essays by an author and blogger who splits her time between Hollywood meetings and living in a liberal suburban town in a red state.

Title: MAKE CHANGE
Author: Shaun King
Description: A look at how social movements evolve and ways in which activists can sustain their efforts.

Title: LIVE IN LOVE
Author: Lauren Akins with Mark Dagostino
Description: The wife of the country music singer Thomas Rhett describes her mission work and life in the spotlight.

Title: LADY IN WAITING
Author: Anne Glenconner
Description: A memoir that provides a look into the royal family by a lady-in-waiting to Princess Margaret.

Title: KILLING CRAZY HORSE
Author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
Description: The ninth book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series focuses on conflicts with Native Americans.

Title: INTIMATIONS
Author: Zadie Smith
Description: Six essays exploring topics, such as isolation, compassion and the relationship between time and work, which were considered during an unprecedented situation.

Title: INCOMPARABLE
Author: Brie Bella and Nikki Bella
Description: The identical twins and WWE Hall of Famers share some of the challenges they faced.

Title: I'M YOUR HUCKLEBERRY
Author: Val Kilmer
Description: The actor recalls his career highlights, romances and the toll cancer has taken on his voice.

Title: A VERY PUNCHABLE FACE
Author: Colin Jost
Description: Snippets of the “Saturday Night Live” head writer’s life including growing up on Staten Island, performing in rural college cafeterias and competing in a WrestleMania match.
